intro: Kefersteinia lafontainei, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, needle-like leaves. It produces white or pinkish flowers in spring, which are clustered in inflorescences. Kefersteinia lafontainei is well adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, making it a hardy plant in suitable climates.
